subject: Testing JOptionPane
msgSnippet: I have a GUI testing question that I hope someone can help me with.  I have read William Wake s excellent GUI testing article
messageBody:
I have a GUI testing question that I hope someone can help me with. I have
read William Wake's excellent GUI testing article
http://users.vnet.net/wwake/xp/xp0001/index.shtml and I am using it with
much success. However, I want to write a test that verifies that when a
certain action is taken, a JOptionPane pops up with an information message.

Since the JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(...) method presents a modal dialog
and the thread halts execution until a user intervenes how can I test this?

here is the test case I am struggling with:

public void testInformationMessage( )
{
MyPanel panel = new MyPanel();
panel.someButton.doClick(); //MyPanel will listen for button click
and show info message

// assert???????? what do I assert here....after returning from
doClick it is to late because
//the JOptionPane would be closed
//furthermore...how will I even automate the click on the OK button
within the JOptionPane
//so it does not just hang indefinitely?
}

Thanks in advance for your help.
